gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: The Data provide the Government, the geological community, consultants, and the public with information on the geologic basis of the African continent. It is intented to be used as reference spatial data.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Map showing Geology, Oil and Gas Fields, and Geologic Provinces of Africa

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: Native Dataset Environment: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 8.1.1.649

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Geological Survey, Central Energy Team

gmd:orderingInstructions.gco:CharacterString: Access Instructions: This URL links to a web-based interactive mapping system that accesses an ArcIMS Image Map Service that runs in Netscape 4.7, Internet Explorer 4.5 and higher. The mapservice can also be accessed using any custom client that adheres to the protocol specified through ArcXML. Ordering Instructions: This product can be downloaded individually using any one of the digital form, Network_Resouce_Name URLS above. Each of these URLs may provide access to various formats of the same product. To order CD-ROM, contact USGS Earth Science Information Center 1-800-ASK-USGS.

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: 1. Original geological maps are of 500 m. maximum accuracy (0.1 mm on paper map of 1:5,000,000 scale). 2. Scanned images were of 200 dot/inch resolution (0.12 mm on paper). That is why fuzzy tolerance for CLEAN program in ARC/INFO was set to 500 m. Average positional accuracy can be evaluated as 1000 m (twice of fuzzy tolerance).

Several geological age subdivisions on the original (UNESCO) 1:5,000,000 geologic maps were combined into a single unit. As of May, 2000, generalizations of the original geologic map (UNESCO) were carried out: 1. All the Cretaceous units were combined into one. 2. All the Precambrian subdivisions were combined into one. Boundaries are correct as of July, 1997.

Several geological age subdivisions on the original (UNESCO) 1:5,000,000 geologic maps were combined into a single unit. As of May, 2000, generalizations of the original geologic map (UNESCO) were carried out: 1. All the Cretaceous units were combined into one. 2. All the Precambrian subdivisions were combined into one. Boundaries are correct as of July, 1997.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: Since the data set is the ARC/INFO coverage topological consistency are supported. Fuzzy tolerance has been maintained the same through all processing steps. Based on fuzzy tolerance value all undershoots and overshoots were detected and deleted. A comparison between color plot and original paper map was carried out by visual comparison. Color plots in 1:5,000,000 scale were superimposed on every of correspondent original map sheets. All detected errors in attributes were corrected.

All the Attributes besides standard ARC/INFO are character type. Standard verification of attributes reliability has been done by ARC/INFO EDITPLOT program to find out polygons without assigned character value or with more than one value.

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: Standard ARC/INFO attribute accuracy in Feature Attribute Tables like AREA, PERIMETER, etc. depend on horizontal positional accuracy. All the additional attributes are character type.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Transparent mylar film was used to extract geologic boundaries from paper geologic maps.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Geological Survey, Central Energy Resources Team

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Geological Survey, P.O. Box 25046, MS 939, Denver Federal Center

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Scanning mylars on large format Anatech Eagle scanner in binary mode. Vectorizing binary images in UNIX ArcInfo 7.0.1 to produce ArcInfo coverages by GRIDLINE utility.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: US Geological Survey, Central Energy Resources Team

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Geological Survey, P.O. Box 25046, MS 939, Denver Federal Center

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Scanning original paper maps on a large format Anatech Eagle scanner in gray-scale mode.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Geological Survey, Central Energy Resources Team

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Geological Survey, P.O. Box 25046, MS 939, Denver Federal Center

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Geologic age attributes were assigned to ArcInfo polygon coverage

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Geologcal Survey, Central Energy Resources Team

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: ArcInfo coverages from binary images were transformed to Transverse Mercator projection with central meridian of 16° E and scale factor at a central meridian equal to 0.995.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Geological Survey, Central Energy Resources Team

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Geological Survey, P.O. Box 25046, MS 939, Denver Federal Center

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Gray-scale images were georeferenced by ArcInfo REGISTER and RECTIFY utilities by using projected ArcInfo coverages from binary images.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Geological Survey, Central Energy Resources Team

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Geological Survey, P.O. Box 25046, MS 939, Denver Federal Center

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Verification and correction of line work and geologic attributing of projected ArcInfo coverages by using georeferenced gray-scale images as background images in ArcInfo ArcEdit 7.0.2

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Geological Survey, Central Energy Resources Team

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Corrected ArcInfo coverages were projected to geographic coordinates and to Mercator projection with a central meridian of 25 E by ArcInfo PROJECT utility.
